image.altText: Aerial photograph of a rose garden planted in the shape of an Arabian horse.

props.synopsis: When a Facebook group of nearly 2 million Google Earth enthusiasts homed in on a satellite image of an odd garden in northern Tasmania, its creator responded.

title.children: 'Thanks for noticing': Secret garden spotted on Google Earth 25 years after being built

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Row over 'unauthorised' landing of 16 helicopters on beach revealed

image.altText: Robert George Greig.

props.synopsis: There is no evidence police shot a man they had been pursuing for weeks over the attempted murder of three police officers, an inquest is told â€” with the man's father saying he will believe his son was shot "until the day I die".

title.children: Father tells inquest he believes police shot fugitive son after chase

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt checking a rain gauge.

props.synopsis:
Thousands of Australians contribute data to the Bureau of Meteorology, but it's the Nichols family's multi-generational commitment that sets them apart.

Â

title.children: Farming family recognised for century's worth of rain data

image.altText: A bald man with a white beard and red top sits at a table.

props.synopsis: A northern Tasmanian retiree's fight to keep his home after receiving an eviction notice by the owners of the caravan park he resides at continues. If unsuccessful, he could be forced to demolish or abandon his home.

title.children: Caravan park resident fighting eviction has case stepped up to Supreme Court

image.altText: Salmon in a fish farm enclosure, seen from underwater, image from Tassal.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a way of wedging politicians between industry and the environment, between jobs and endangered species â€” with Labor and Liberal strategists well aware of the votes which are at stake.

title.children: Pro-environment or pro-industry? Can Labor walk the Tasmanian tightrope?

image.altText: Two macaque monkeys sit on a wall.

props.synopsis: A visit to the 'monkey park' has been a part of this Tasmanian city's appeal since the late 1800s, so what is the history of Launceston's Monkey Island? And does it have a future?

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£How Launceston got its monkeys â€” and why they could be gone within decades

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: A boy goes to give an excited Albanese a high five in a classroom

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will pledge to replace a test that ties access to subsidised childcare to the number of hours parents work each fortnight.

title.children: Activity test for childcare subsidies to be scrapped if Labor is re-elected

image.altText: plane sunset generic thumbnail

props.synopsis: As Australians gear up for the holiday season, new research reveals the growing environmental cost of global tourism.

title.children: Tourism now makes up one-tenth of global emissions

image.altText: A collection of scrolled parchments.

props.synopsis: As counter-terrorism police investigate the torching of a Melbourne synagogue on Friday, its community is fighting to save priceless Torah scrolls damaged in the arson attack.

title.children: Inside the fight to save holy scrolls damaged in synagogue blaze

image.altText: A hand holds the Essure contraceptive device

props.synopsis: Despite a Victorian judge rejecting claims that a female contraceptive device caused them major health problems, women engaged in a class action have vowed to keep fighting.

title.children: Women disappointed by Essure class action judgement vow to fight on

image.altText: Helicopter landed on a beach with people nearby.

props.synopsis: From the air it must have looked a great spot to land, a big stretch of white sand and miles from anywhere. Little did this "helicopter safari" group know, one of Tasmania's most vocal opponents to helicopters in wilderness areas was watching on.

title.children: Outrage revealed over 'helicopter safari' mass landing on remote beach

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: An investigation found the telecommunications company made 473 breaches during a disruption in March, with Telstra's Triple Zero call centre failing to properly transfer calls to emergency services.

title.children: Telstra slapped with $3 million fine for triple-0 network outage

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair wearing a traditional red headwrap and belt. Iraq village in background

props.synopsis: Thirty-eight young people have been named 2025 ABC Heywire winners for their resilience, courage and desire to create change. Here's where you can find their stories.

title.children: Heywire winners reveal 'brave and authentic' stories of regional Australia

image.altText: man wearing suit with press pack behind them

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu is set to give testimony for the first time after being charged with bribery, fraud and breach of public trust in three separate cases.Â

title.children: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fronts corruption trial

image.altText: A man withdraws cash from an ATM in Singapore

props.synopsis: Singaporean scam victims could lose access to their own money as the country ramps up efforts to curb hundreds of millions of dollars lost to scams.

title.children: Singapore's radical solution to global scam epidemic

image.altText: Charli XCX with messy hair wearing a white shirt and looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: In a blockbuster year for music releases, nothing excited us more than these 50 albums.

title.children: Fifty incredible 2024 albums that weren't released by Taylor Swift

image.altText: Aerial photograph of a rose garden planted in the shape of an Arabian horse.

props.synopsis: When a Facebook group of nearly 2 million Google Earth enthusiasts homed in on a satellite image of an odd garden in northern Tasmania, its creator responded.

title.children: 'Thanks for noticing': Secret garden spotted on Google Earth 25 years after being built

image.altText: A police officer carrying a woman from a building following an airstrike.

props.synopsis: The comments come after Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy told incoming US President Donald Trump he would be open to talks, but was sceptical Vladimir Putin would want peace.

title.children: Ukraine hit by strikes as ally hints peace talks possible within months

image.altText: Exterior of Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The Australian Human Rights Commission says it is "very concerned" that female detainees are being held in compounds next to men separated due to the nature of their offending, including sexual offences.

title.children: Women held near sex offenders at Sydney immigration detention centre

image.altText: A woman makes a love heart with her hands and smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Sasha Skochilenko's decision to speak out about Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine landed her a seven-year prison sentence. While she was behind bars, support arrived in her cell from an unexpected source â€” Australia.

title.children: Russian activist's seven-year sentence eased by letters from Australia

image.altText: A woman holds a thermal camera, pointing it at a construction site and reading the screen.

props.synopsis: CoreLogic data shows the 6.27 million homes built pre-2010 have a median 2.8-star energy rating, while the 1.5 million built post-2010 have a median 5.9 rating.

title.children: Homes built after 2010 'twice as energy-efficient as older homes'

image.altText: Victoria Bitter

props.synopsis: The National Film and Sound Archives' 10 new additions to the Sounds of Australia registry include Chains by Tina Arena, the original Doctor Who theme, and an iconic ad for Victoria Bitter beer.

title.children: 'A hard-earned thirst needs a big cold beer': Victoria Bitter ad among new Sounds of Australia

image.altText: A booking photograph of Luigi Mangione at State Correctional Institution

props.synopsis: New York prosecutors have filed murder and other charges against Luigi Nicholas Mangione in the killing of UnitedHealthcare's CEO, according to an online court docket.

title.children: Luigi Mangione charged with murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO

image.altText: Luigi Mangione holds a McDonald's Happy Meal box up next to his face while sitting in a car.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old Maryland man was arrested with a gun believed to be the one used in the killing and writings suggesting his anger with corporate America.

title.children: What we know about Luigi Mangione, the accused CEO killer

image.altText: red tomatoes at the supermarket

props.synopsis: The price of truss tomatoes across Australia is expected to stay down in the lead up to Christmas. That might be good thing for shoppers, but some growers say they're struggling to break even.

title.children: 'There is certainly a glut': Truss tomato growers call for shoppers to help combat oversupply

image.altText: Unidentified woman seated on a couch. She's wearing leggings and a grey cardigan.

props.synopsis: Victim-survivors escaping domestic violence are often sent to motels or hotels, but support service Safe Steps says 'critical incidents' are on the rise. That's why they're doing things differently with Sanctuary, a wrap-around crisis accommodation model that boasts a safe exit rate of 98 per cent.

title.children: 'It saves lives': Support system for women fleeing violence has 98pc safe-exit rate

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: The RBA has kept the cash rate unchanged at 4.35 per cent in December, for a ninth-straight meeting. The next chance borrowers have for a reprieve is in February.

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps rates on hold but leaves door open to February cut

image.altText: An old magazine advertisement showing smiling women.

props.synopsis: KPMG announced it would be closing all of Mosaic Group's Katie stores after it was found the business was largely operating at a loss.

title.children: Katies store closures are a tipping point for old-school bricks-and-mortar fashion

image.altText: Albanese gestures with both hands, a crowd of Jewish men flanking him.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has assured the Adass Israel community in Melbourne that his government will provide "whatever support is necessary financially" to rebuild the burnt synagogue.

title.children: Albanese vows to help rebuild synagogue during much-anticipated visit

image.altText: A man speaks stands up and speaks with a microphone inside an elaborate gold mosque

props.synopsis: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad raises critical questions about the future of Syria and who speaks for its people. Here's what we know about Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and its leader, Abu Mohammad al-Golani.

title.children: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Golani, the man facing a $10 million bounty?

image.altText: A female soldier points at a map while three police officers look at it.

props.synopsis: While the Pacific Policing Initiative has won wide backing from Pacific leaders and police chiefs, it has also generated some cynicism in the region.

title.children: Australia opens $400 million Pacific Policing Initiative in Brisbane

image.altText: A man in a cap looks with a suspicious look on his face.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has green lit environmental plans for two mineral sands mines in western Victoria, which will cover a combined 5,000 hectares of agricultural land.

title.children: Farmers devastated as mineral sands mines receive environmental approval

image.altText: Kate Sylvia taking a selfie.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the death of Kate Sylvia hears the 32-year-old died from brain bleeds and blood clots just days after being diagnosed with a migraine.

title.children: Woman died from brain bleeds after migraine diagnosis, inquest hears
